cellot.models package¶

Submodules¶

cellot.models.ae module¶

Implementation of autoencoders.

class cellot.models.ae.AutoEncoder(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: Module

Implementation of autoencoders inherited from nn.Module.

Variables:

  • beta – regularization coefficient.

  • latent_dim – latent dimension of the embedding.

  • hidden_units – list of number of hidden units for encoder and decoder.

  • encoder_net – encoder module of the autoencoder.

  • decoder_net – decoder module of the autoencoder.

  • mse – mean square loss for the autoencoder.

LossComps¶

alias of AELoss

Outputs¶

alias of AEOutputs

build_decoder(input_dim, latent_dim, hidden_units, **kwargs)¶

Loads a decoder module for the autoencoder.

The hidden units are reversed from the encoder module.

build_encoder(input_dim, latent_dim, hidden_units, **kwargs)¶

Loads an encoder module for the autoencoder.

compute_encoding_shift(dataset, labels)¶

Computes the shift between encodings of control cells and encodings of perturbed cells.

decode(code, **kwargs)¶

Recovers the input from the encodings.

encode(inputs, **kwargs)¶

Computes the encodings given input features.

forward(inputs, **kwargs)¶

Given inputs, returns the loss, the composition of loss and the outputs.

loss(inputs, outputs)¶

Computes the loss on some inputs and its corresponding compositions.

outputs(inputs, **kwargs)¶

Computes the ouput given input features.

predict(inputs, source, target, decode=True)¶

Predicts the features of cells under some perturbation using AutoEncoder.

Parameters:

  • model – AutoEncoder, model used for prediction.

  • inputs – inputs of the model.

  • source – initial condition of the cells.

  • target – target condition of the cells.

  • decode – bool, whether to use the decoding module. Default is True.

class cellot.models.ae.ConditionalAutoEncoder(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: AutoEncoder

Conditional autoencoders inherited from the AutoEncoder class.

Variables:

  • conditions – list of conditions considered.

  • n_cats – number of conditions considered.

build_decoder(input_dim, latent_dim, hidden_units, **kwargs)¶

Builds the decoder module using the method from AutoEncoder. The encoding dimension equals to the latent dimension plus the dimension of one-hot vectors which represent the conditions.

build_encoder(input_dim, latent_dim, hidden_units, **kwargs)¶

Builds the encoder module using the method from AutoEncoder. The input dimension equals to the feature dimension plus the dimension of one-hot vectors which represent the conditions.

condition(data, labels)¶

Extends the features with conditions using one-hot vectors.

decode(codes, **kwargs)¶

Decodes the latent embeddings with conditions.

encode(inputs, **kwargs)¶

Encodes the input features with conditions.

forward(inputs, beta=None, **kwargs)¶

Forward pass function to compute the outputs, the corresponding loss and its compositions.

outputs(inputs, decode_as=None, **kwargs)¶

Computes the outputs using inputs with conditions.

predict(inputs, target)¶

Predicts the reconstruction for some inputs with conditions using ConditionalAutoEncoder.

Parameters:

  • model – ConditionalAutoEncoder, model to reconstruct the inputs.

  • inputs – inputs for the model.

  • target – the condition used for the reconstruction.

Returns:

The reconstruction outputs.

class cellot.models.ae.DNN(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: module

Implementation of dense neural networks.

cellot.models.ae.compute_scgen_shift()¶

Created for other modules’ dependencies.

cellot.models.ae.dnn(dinput, doutput, hidden_units=(16, 16), activation='ReLU', dropout=0.0, batch_norm=False, net_fn=torch.nn.Sequential, **kwargs)¶

Loads a deep neural network.

Parameters:

  • dinput – int, input dimension.

  • doutput – int, output dimension.

  • hidden_units – tuple, number of units on each hidden layer. Default is (16, 16).

  • activation – activation function. Default is “ReLU”.

  • dropout – dropout rate. Default is 0.0.

  • batch_norm – batch normalization. Default is False.

  • **kwargs – additional parameters.

Returns:

A torch.nn DNN.

cellot.models.ae.load_autoencoder_model(config, restore=None, **kwargs)¶

Loads an autoencoder.

Parameters:

  • config – configuration of autoencoders.

  • restore – file path from which a previous state is restored. Default is None.

  • **kwargs – dict to load autoencoders.

Returns:

  1. An instance of the required autoencoder.

  2. A torch.optim.Adam optimizer.

cellot.models.ae.load_networks(config, **kwargs)¶

Loads the network structure of autoencoders.

Parameters:

  • config – configuration of autoencoders.

  • **kwargs – dict to load autoencoders.

Returns:

An instance of the required autoencoder.

cellot.models.ae.load_optimizer(config, params)¶

Loads Adam optimizer for autoencoders.

Parameters:

  • config – configuration of autoencoders.

  • params – parameters for Adam optimizer.

Returns:

A torch.optim.Adam optimizer.

cellot.models.cellot module¶

Implementation of the CellOT structure.

class cellot.models.cellot.CellOT(config, restore=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Implementation of the CellOT structure.

Variables:

  • f (ICNN) – one of the dual networks.

  • g (ICNN) – one of the dual networks.

  • opts (FGPair) – optimizers for f and g.

build_networks(config, **kwargs)¶

Builds dual potential ICNNs with specified configuration.

build_opts(config)¶

Builds optimizers for CELLOT networks.

compute_g_constraint(form=None, beta=0)¶

Computes the additional penalty for negative weights of g.

Parameters:

  • form – indicates which type of measure is performed for negative weights. Default is None.

  • beta – penalty strength. Default is 0.

compute_loss_f(source: torch.tensor, target: torch.tensor, transport: Optional[torch.tensor] = None)¶

Computes the loss of ICNN f given input features and predicted features.

compute_loss_g(source: torch.tensor, transport: Optional[torch.tensor] = None)¶

Computes the loss of ICNN g given input features and predicted features.

compute_w2_distance(source, target, transport=None)¶

Computes the 2-norm Wasserstein distance between predictions and targets.

predict(inputs: torch.tensor)¶

Predicts the cell features after perturbation with CellOT.

restore(restore=None)¶

Restores a previous state.

cellot.models.cellot.numerical_gradient(param: float, fxn, *args, eps=0.0001)¶

Numerically computes the gradient of a function at some point.

Parameters:

  • param – float, the parameter to define the input position of the function.

  • fxn – the function of which the gradient is computed on.

  • *args – the arguments of the function.

  • eps – the small value perturbed on the param. Default is 1e-4.

Returns:

The gradient of fxn at *args.
